[{"id":"ST-689","entityId":"64-8095","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"ST"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"689"},{"name":"summary","value":"Job takes 6 minutes to start running after play is pressed."},{"name":"description","value":"
This issue is occurring also on the most recent trunk versions as well as the show branch from a few months ago.

Discovered while checking out JUB-882. Originally, that job would not run at all. What I found today is that it takes about 5-6 minutes after pressing play before the job starts lasering. The job does run correctly, although it has a lot of brief pauses throughout the job.

I cannot export this job as issue JUB-881 is still a problem. I imported & ran the attached PDF (world map - black.pdf)
All times are approximate.
13:15:00 Press Play
13:15:06 Air assist comes on
13:20:30 Actual engraving starts
13:47:30 Job finishes correctly
"},{"name":"created","value":"1520628934336"},{"name":"updated","value":"1533307830984"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"tcrews"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Tim Crews"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"jsnead"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Jerry Snead"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"12"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"ST-478","type":"Duplicate","role":"is duplicated by"}]},{"name":"Priority","value":["Major"],"valueId":["Major"],"color":{"bg":"#ffee9c","fg":"#b45f06"}},{"name":"Type","value":["Feature"],"valueId":["Feature"],"color":null},{"name":"State","value":["Open"],"valueId":["Open"],"color":{"bg":"#0070e4","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"tmclachlan","fullName":"Tyler McLachlan"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"World Map - Black.pdf","id":"70-6634","url":"http://youtrack.intranet.ulsinc.com/_persistent/World%20Map%20-%20Black.pdf?file=70-6634&c=true"},{"value":"control.log","id":"70-6635","url":"http://youtrack.intranet.ulsinc.com/_persistent/control.log?file=70-6635&c=true"},{"value":"image.png","id":"70-6968","url":"http://youtrack.intranet.ulsinc.com/_persistent/image.png?file=70-6968&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"69-14459","author":"Miles","authorFullName":"Miles McNerney","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
I remember this is a tough one to plan, we've seen an issue with this before. Jerry Snead Try turning off Sorting, see if that speeds up planning.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526089259816,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14466","author":"jsnead","authorFullName":"Jerry Snead","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
All times are approximate. Sorting doesn't seem to have much of an impact:

Inner-Outer (Job takes 7 minutes to start lasering after play is pressed)
09:14:00 Start
09:14:14 Air On
09:21:00 Lasering Starts
10:01:06 Job Completes

Nearest Neighbor (Job takes 7.5 minutes to start lasering after play is pressed)
10:12:00 Start
10:12:14 Air On
10:19:30 Lasering Starts
10:59:30 Job Completes

None / Original (Job takes 7 minutes to start lasering after play is pressed)
11:01:00 Start
11:01:13 Air On
11:08:00 Lasering Starts
11:49:24 Job Complete
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526322427744,"updated":1526323798306,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14467","author":"Miles","authorFullName":"Miles McNerney","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
OK well thanks. Anyway that shoots that theory down
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526325968477,"updated":1526089259800,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14470","author":"Miles","authorFullName":"Miles McNerney","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
When I try to import the attached WorldMap file in Windows, this code below in PrintQueue.cpp throws an exception on a process where red, blue, and green are all NAN values. I stubbed it out just to get the import to happen

//for (auto & process : processes)
//{
// auto processType = process.process;
// process.colors.erase(std::remove_if(
// process.colors.begin(), process.colors.end(),
// [processType, colorUsages](auto & processColor)
// {
// return std::none_of(
// colorUsages.begin(), colorUsages.end(),
// [processType, processColor](auto & colorUsage)
// {
// return ULS::sameColor(processColor, colorUsage.color) && ULS::usableProcess(processType, colorUsage.usage);
// });
// }));
//}
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526337841714,"updated":1526325968472,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14471","author":"Miles","authorFullName":"Miles McNerney","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
One thing that strikes me as odd here is, when the job is (I think) planning, all 4 of the CPUs are maxed out. But I know that on the XLS, the Planner really runs in the context of only one CPU.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526339828231,"updated":1526341182803,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14472","author":"Miles","authorFullName":"Miles McNerney","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":true,"jiraId":null,"text":"
!image2.png!
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526339901208,"updated":1526339828231,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14474","author":"Miles","authorFullName":"Miles McNerney","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
So I asked Jerry to run this on the XLS (stable branch) to see if we get commensurate times
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526341107689,"updated":1526339901208,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14475","author":"Miles","authorFullName":"Miles McNerney","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Jerry also said he ran a reduced version of this image (removed some of the graphics data) and it ran after 30 seconds delay.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526341258869,"updated":1526341107689,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14483","author":"jsnead","authorFullName":"Jerry Snead","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Additional Testing - all times approximate:

ILS .95 UCP
07:46:00 Start Job
07:46:10 Start Lasering
10 Second Lag
Job seems to run really slow (I used default settings for anodized aluminum. Could get faster performance with higher throughput & vector speed but am only testing for time difference between when the play button is pushed and when the actual lasering starts).

XLS Ultra Trunk 122
07:59:00 Start Job
08:05:58 Start Lasering
~ 7 Minute Lag

XLS Stable 2018.04.25.0426
08:16:00 Start Job
08:25:58 Start Lasering
~ 9 Minute Lag
(also the Windows clock froze @ 08:16:06 and did not unfreeze until 08:18:10. I suspect this is just Windows and hardware being taxed by the job).
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526398289170,"updated":1526322427744,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14484","author":"jsnead","authorFullName":"Jerry Snead","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
De-escalting per Chris to major. Chris asked if there was a previous stable LSM that started this job quicker and the short answer is no. I have been using this file for about six months? and it always seems to be slow to start with the Stable LSM or Ultra.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526400581251,"updated":1526398289154,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14627","author":"tcrews","authorFullName":"Tim Crews","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
The six-minute delay is caused by the NURBS extrema finding algorithm, which has particular trouble with this artwork because the world map outlines consist of enormous, detailed NURBS curves.

On Windows only, NURBS extrema finding uses all available CPU cores. On my very fast AMD Ryzen PC with 12 CPU cores, I can find the extrema in 20 seconds instead of six minutes. Unfortunately, it is so aggressive about using all cores that the system becomes unresponsive while the extrema finding is in progress. I made changes to prevent this back in November 2017, but apparently they are not working. I will add a TODO at that point in the code.

On Linux, NURBS extrema finding only uses one CPU core at a time. So I am surprised that the trunk software running on Linux doesn't take even longer than the six minutes that the Stable software takes on Windows.

To solve this problem, we will have to find a more intelligent algorithm for finding the extrema in a NURBS curve. We are currently using an algorithm of my own devising, which is surely naive. This will be a research project best left to a professional mathematician. I have already scoured The NURBS Book (written by a professional mathematician!) looking for a solution, but didn't find anything.

Another alternative, which would also entail a research project, would be to eliminate the need for the knowledge of the NURBS extrema. The extrema are used when searching for intersections between the NURBS curve and the kinematic constraint box in the NURBSBoxIntersection class.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526645821978,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14628","author":"tcrews","authorFullName":"Tim Crews","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
The reason that only the Windows version of the control service uses all available CPU cores for NURBS extrema finding is that there is not (yet) a cross-platform way to accomplish that. On Windows, we are using the MSVC-specific <ppl.h> library.

The cross-platform alternative to <ppl.h> is the new C++17 overload of the for_each algorithm, which takes an execution_policy argument that you can use to request a parallel execution of the loop. (http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/algorithm/execution_policy_tag_t)

The execution_policy type is defined in the <execution> header. Unfortunately, at this time the <execution> header is not available for any of our three compiler toolchains (Windows MSVC, Linux gcc, or Apple Clang).
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1526646805892,"updated":1526645821963,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-15188","author":"Miles","authorFullName":"Miles McNerney","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":true,"jiraId":null,"text":"
I believe I fixed this as part of ST-524 Job takes about 30 seconds to start after play is pressed - no visible activity on GUI or machine

Edit: No, that was a raster optimization problem. This problem is related to vectors, never mind
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1529365312843,"updated":1529365422169,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-15491","author":"tcrews","authorFullName":"Tim Crews","issueId":"ST-689","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
With a change I committed today, Jubilee will display a progress bar during this long delay, with the description "Scanning artwork geometry". [Edit: It turns out that feature isn't working yet. I will cover that problem in a different YouTrack issue.]
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1530450612967,"updated":1530453942081,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"ST-9","entityId":"64-4975","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"ST"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"9"},{"name":"summary","value":"Implement DatabaseMigrator using cross-platform technology"},{"name":"description","value":"
If we are going to run the DB Server on Linux and macOS, then we will need to be able to install and upgrade the materials database on those platforms, which I think means we will need to run the DatabaseMigrator application.

DatabaseMigrator is written in C#. That in itself is not a show-stopper, because Mono is available for Mac OS. But DatabaseMigrator also depends on a few NuGet packages that might not be available in that environment.

Austyn and I have discussed this. We are leaning towards using C++ and SOCI, the same technology used by DB Server itself.
"},{"name":"created","value":"1488297180566"},{"name":"updated","value":"1533233637597"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"tcrews"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Tim Crews"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"tcrews"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Tim Crews"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"4"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"ST-583","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-584","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-585","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-586","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-587","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"ST-632","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"}]},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Type","value":["Feature"],"valueId":["Feature"],"color":null},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#fed74a","fg":"#444"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"tmclachlan","fullName":"Tyler McLachlan"}]},{"name":"Milestone","value":["2018 08 10"],"valueId":["2018 08 10"],"color":null}],"comment":[{"id":"69-14741","author":"tcrews","authorFullName":"Tim Crews","issueId":"ST-9","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Tyler McLachlan will start working on this now. Although he has a YouTrack login, his user name does not appear in the list of available names for the Assignee field.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1527531817180,"updated":1527531827679,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-14932","author":"wvalentine","authorFullName":"Wendy Valentine","issueId":"ST-9","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Tim Crews Can we turn this into a feature with subtasks to track?
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1528157666576,"updated":null,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-15163","author":"tcrews","authorFullName":"Tim Crews","issueId":"ST-9","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
This will not actually be done by 6/15, but it does have to be done before the software is deployed. I didn't want this feature to get lost.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1528977826716,"updated":1527531817165,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]},{"id":"69-15169","author":"wvalentine","authorFullName":"Wendy Valentine","issueId":"ST-9","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Tim Crews Tyler McLachlan Do we have a timeline on this yet?
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1528990926983,"updated":1528157666576,"permittedGroup":null,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}]
